player.name: Delve/Donate
player.author: tracer
player.description: Fill deck with Silver then trash everything else and start greening

player.name: Giant
player.author: tracer
player.description: Optimized against Smithy

player.name: Dungeon
player.author: tracer
player.description: Optimized against Embassy

player.name: Borrow
player.author: WanderingWinder, tracer
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys only treasure. And Borrow. Which makes a huge difference.

player.name: Beggar/Triumph
player.author: Emil
player.description: Build points lead and sit on it, ending game optional

player.name: Beggar/Gardens
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Beggar/Gardens combo

player.name: Ranger/Lost Arts
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Ranger/Lost Arts combo

player.name: Fool's Gold/Wharf
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: If you're the only player going for the Fool's Golds, you'll win easily as proven by this bot.

player.name: Treasure Map/Dungeon
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Treasure Map/Dungeon combo

player.name: Tournament/Hunting Party
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Tournament + Hunting Party combo

player.name: Jack/Bonfire
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Jack + Bonfire combo

player.name: Ironmonger/Inheritance
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Ironmonger + Inheritance combo

player.name: Courtyard/Delve
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Courtyard + Delve combo

player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Cultist + Lurker combo

player.description: Cultist + Ferry combo

player.author: Geronimoo

player.description: Governor + Ferry combo

player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Dungeon + Tunnel combo

player.name: Bridge/Royal Carriage
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Bridge + RC combo

player.name: Jack/Villa
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Jack + Villa combo

player.name: Rebuild/Ferry
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Rebuild + Ferry combo

player.name: City Quarter/Council Room
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: KOTW oktober 2016

player.name: Shelters
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys only treasure.

player.name: Lab/Militia/Chapel
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A Base game strategy

player.name: Apprentice/Market Square
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Beastly combo

player.name: Peasant
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Hermit/Bridge
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Black Market (test code)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Counting House/Travelling Fair
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Big Combo!

player.name: Gear
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Gear Big Money is extremely strong. Probably the strongest Big Money Enabler

player.name: Journeyman engine
player.author: Computer
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Hireling/KC/Monument
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A massive engine powered by KC and Hireling with Monuments for payload

player.name: Oracle/Venture
player.author: WW
player.description: The optimized Oracle bot that buys no other actions.

player.name: Rabble/Fishing Village
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The optimized Rabble strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Ironworks/Island/Silk Road
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: No description available

player.name: Embassy/Tunnel
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The optimized Embassy strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Death Cart/Gardens
player.author: Computer
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Duplicat/Duke
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Gain a bunch of Duplicates to empty the Duchy and Duke piles in a few turns.

player.name: Council Room/Militia
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Council Room engine with Militia

player.name: Council Room/Treasure Map
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This engine uses Treasure Map for payload and Militia to slow down opponents

player.name: Cultist/Procession
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Bot from KotW 10/25

player.name: Cultist
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Cultist chaining for the win

player.name: Workshop/Vineyard mirror
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The mirror bot that tries to win the Vineyard split

player.name: Workshop/Vineyard
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The one minded bot that goes for big Vineyards

player.name: Duke/Cache mirror
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The Duke slog enabled by Cache. This is the optimized player for the mirror match.

player.name: Duke/Cache
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The Duke slog enabled by Cache.

player.name: Ironworks/Gardens (Scissors)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This variant will play a slog game using Ironworks as a source of economy.

player.name: Ironworks/Gardens (Paper)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This rush variant will try to win the Gardens split.

player.name: Ironworks/Gardens (Rock)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The default Ironworks/Gardens rush.

player.name: Governor
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Ironworks/Island/GH
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: No description available

player.name: Fishing Village/Wharf
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Bureaucrat/Gardens
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Bureaucrat is a decent Gardens enabler.

player.name: Familiar (unlucky 3rd turn)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has a fixed start state where it starts turn 3 and unable to buy a Familiar.

player.name: Familiar (lucky 3rd turn)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot has a fixed start state where it starts turn 3 buying a Familiar.

player.name: Familiar
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Familiar is often one of the defining cards on a board.

player.name: Haggler/Border Village
player.author: Computer
player.description: This bot has been generated by the computer without any optimization. XXXXIt just buys a single Action card and money

player.name: Governor/Warehouse
player.author: HiveMindEmulator
player.description: Governor gains Golds early, then starts remodeling those Golds into Provinces.XXXXWarehouse gets Golds and Governors together. XXXXWhen Provinces are almost gone, Governor is used to draw cards for a mega turn.

player.name: Wharf/Hamlet/Bridge
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Get a few Universities to get Wharves. Finish with Bridges.

player.name: Hunting Party/Baron
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This combo is quite sick. It doesn't even need Golds to race the Provinces

player.name: Tunnel/Young Witch
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A devestating combo: the Witch destroys the opponent's deck while Tunneling for Golds in your own deck.

player.name: Apothecary/Native Village
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy was created by Mean Mr Mustard. It uses Native Village to set aside the greens/Curses so they are not drawn again.XXXXApothecary makes sure you can always put a green card on top. XXXXIt does need one extra card to make this competitive (Scheme)

player.name: Ill-Gotten Gains
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Get all the Ill-Gotten Gains and Duchies to empty 3 piles.

player.name: Black Market (test)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A test bot to see if all the cards work and interact without bugs. We do this by buying a single Black Market and a Potion.

player.name: Jack of all Trades
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Jack combines the effects of Workshop, Spy, Library and Trade Route in a tuned down version.XXXXIt's very powerful for money-based strategies!

player.name: Scheme/Sea Hag
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Getting to play your Sea Hag each turn is nice!

player.name: Fool's Gold/Council Room
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: If you're the only player going for the Fool's Golds, you'll win easily as proven by this bot.

player.name: Tunnel/Embassy
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Discarding Tunnels for Golds was never easier than with Embassy!

player.name: Embassy
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Embassy strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Duchess/Duke
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The happy couple in their Duchy. It doesn't buy Provinces and crushes any non-attacking strategy that dismisses it.

player.name: Develop/Ill-Gotten Gains
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot deals out a few Curses after which the Ill-Gotten Gains get Developed into Caravan and Gold for massive value.

player.name: Torturer/Border Village
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy only works because opponents will keep discarding instead of sometimes gaining a Curse.XXXXStrategies that have trashers will however gain a Curse when they have a trasher in hand.

player.name: Ill-Gotten Gains/Gardens
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: More powerful than the Workshop/Gardens combo!

player.name: Tactician/Secret Chamber
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy strives to play Tactician every turn. Secret Chamber allows it to discard the cards for $ before Tactician does.XXXXThis bot is very similar to the Tactician/Vault bot, but it requires an extra engine part to draw cards and get to $8 each turn.XXXXIt's very strong with a $5/$2 opening, but very weak otherwise.

player.name: ann game #4 - yaron
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by yaron in the fourth annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/03/04/guest-article-annotated-game-4/XXXXIt opens Envoy/Silver and tries to ignore Witch defending with Trading Post, which fails miserably.

player.name: ann game #1 - Mountebank/Warehouse
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by theory in the first annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/02/annotated-game-1/XXXXIt opens Warehouse/Silver which proves slightly better than Caravan/Silver which his opponent used

player.name: ann game #1 - Mountebank/Caravan
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by yaron in the first annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/02/annotated-game-1/XXXXIt opens Caravan/Silver which proves slightly worse than Warehouse/Silver which his opponent usedXXXX

player.name: ann game #6 - Geronimoo
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by Geronimoo in the sixth annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/03/23/guest-article-annotated-game-6/XXXXIt opens Envoy/Silver to get a jump start and then buys Wharves and Harems which proved dumb because of opponent's Thieves.

player.name: ann game #3 - Dekker
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by Dekker in the third annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/21/annotated-game-3/XXXXIt opens Talisman/Silver to get multiples of Mining Villages and then onto Hoards, Islands and Harems to stop with Trade Route.

player.name: ann game #4 - Captain_Frisk
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by Captain_Frisk in the fourth annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/03/04/guest-article-annotated-game-4/XXXXIt opens Quarry/Warehouse to get two Witches asap.

player.name: ann game #2 - Baron/Mine
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by theory in the second annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/14/annotated-game-2/XXXXIt uses Baron as a jumpstart, then gets Mines and eventually some Apprentices

player.name: ann game #2 - Apprentice
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by Mean Mr Mustard in the second annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/14/annotated-game-2/XXXXIt uses Apprentice aggressively to draw into its big treasures

player.name: ann game #6 - Thief
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by crduemling in the sixth annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/03/23/guest-article-annotated-game-6/XXXXIt opens Thief/Silver because of the Harem on board. Thief remains a weak card despite of Harem.

player.name: ann game #3 - theory
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is based on the strategy used by theory in the third annotated game: XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/02/21/annotated-game-3/XXXXIt opens Mining Village/Silver, to get to Hoard as quickly as possible. Then it goes for Islands and Harems and Trade Route.

player.name: Vault
player.author: HiveMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Treasury
player.author: HiveMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Basic Big Money
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This is the simplest strategy conceivable that is actually capable of winning games. It buys only Golds, Silvers and Provinces.

player.name: Big Money Ultimate for 3 or 4
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A money only strategy for 3 or 4 players

player.name: Caravan/Vault
player.author: Anonymous
player.description: Caravan is usually a little slow in Province games, but Vault is very happy with the extra cards.XXXXSee also : http://dominionstrategy.com/2010/12/15/combo-of-the-day-20-caravanvault/

player.name: Chancellor/Stash
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A great illustration how two weak cards can combine into a very strong strategy. Also check out:XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2010/12/01/combo-of-the-day-17-chancellorstash/XXXXThis bot is NOT optimal: http://dominionsimulator.wordpress.com/editcreate-your-own-strategy/

player.name: Chapel/Laboratory (Col)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot first makes sure it cycles itself as often as possible in the early turns by buying Labs over Golds.

player.name: Coppersmith/Tactician
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Coppersmith is very weak until you play 7 Coppers in one turn...XXXXThis is only possible due to the extra cards from Tactician AND the selection provided by Warehouse.XXXXThis strategy is one of the fastest to buy Provinces. Don't try without the Warehouses though!

player.name: Costume Party
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Masquerade gets you to a fast Gold after which this strategy will start grabbing Nobles.

player.name: Council Room/Goons
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Add a trasher and a few Villages and this combo is unstoppable. XXXXIt will build up to mega turns with Goons and doesn't even need victory cards.XXXXAlso check out: http://dominionstrategy.com/2010/11/14/combo-of-the-day-8-council-roomgoons/

player.name: Double Moat for 3 or 4
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A defensive double Moat and money strategy for 3 or 4 players

player.name: Drunk Marine Students
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Get a few Universities to get Wharves and a whole bunch of other Action cards. Vineyards are the green card of choice here.XXXXAlso a great illustration of a strategy that absolutely does not want Treasures of any kind (especially Silvers which slow it down)

player.name: Envoy (Col)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Envoy ensures a quick Platinum as it does a quick Gold in a Province deck. XXXXThis strategy isn't as strong in a Colony game because engines get more time to develop.

player.name: Festival/Watchtower
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A treasureless strategy. But it requires strong trashing to get going. XXXXThe engine is a bit too slow to build to make this competitive.

player.name: Ghost Ship/Fishing Village
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy aims to play Ghost Ship every turn to keep the opponent in a stranglehold. XXXXIt actually is perfectly happy never buying a Treasure, but allowing it to buy a few Golds makes it better.

player.name: Golem/Counting House
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This combo makes good use of the interaction between Golem and Counting House:XXXXWhen their is only one non-Golem action in your deck, the entire deck will be put in the discard so Counting House can pick up all the Coppers.XXXXThe problem is that you need to buy up to 11 Coppers to be able to buy Colonies.

player.name: Goons/Menagerie
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Similar to the Council Room combo, but this time we use Menagerie and Hamlet to generate the mega turns.XXXXThis one doesn't have a trasher and is still very strong.

player.name: Horse Traders/Duke
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: This bot is a little weird. It doesn't buy Provinces, loves extra Coppers and crushes any strategy that dismisses it.

player.name: Laboratory
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Laboratory and money isn't a very exciting combination, yet still better than just money.

player.name: Loan/Minion
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Loan will thin the deck so Minions clump together more often. XXXXMinions is quite a hard card to play correctly, so the simulator makes quite a few mistakes with it.XXXXSee here how the simulator handles Minion: http://dominionsimulator.wordpress.com/play-rules/intrigue/minion/

player.name: Militia
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Militia isn't the best attack, but can't be ignored. This bot buys up to three Militias and treasure.

player.name: Minions/Chapel
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Minions love extremely thin decks which is exactly what Chapel does. See also Loan/Minion why this bot underperforms.

player.name: Mountebank
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Mountebank might be the strongest attack. It's a better buy than Gold (so it will be bought with $6)

player.name: Native Village/Bridge
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Bridge is a card that becomes very scary once you're able to play multiples. XXXXNative Village allows this deck to build up to an explosive turn where it buys all the remaining Provinces in one go.XXXXSee also: http://dominionsimulator.wordpress.com/play-rules/seaside/native-village/

player.name: One Coppersmith to rule them all
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Get a single Coppersmith and try to draw it every turn with Laboratories and Wishing Wells. XXXXThis will often build up to buy double Provinces (which is why we need the two Markets). XXXXGolds and Silvers are not needed, all the buying power comes from Coppers!

player.name: Peddling at the Market
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Market is the perfect enabler for aquiring Peddlers. XXXXThis deck can stumble once it starts greening, so it also buys Smithies and Villages.

player.name: Plenty Horny
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot is a response to this article:XXXXhttp://dominionstrategy.com/2011/08/04/guest-article-planning-and-playing-a-new-strategy/XXXXI wanted to prove that Horn of Plenty can easily beat Horse Traders Duke.

player.name: Moat
player.author: HivemMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Shanty Town
player.author: HivemMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Oracle
player.author: WW
player.description: The optimized Oracle bot that buys no other actions.

player.name: Smithy
player.author: HiveMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Possessed!!!!
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy isn't actually capable of buying Colonies, but uses its opponent's buying power to get them.XXXXIt does this by building up to multiple Possessions being played each turn generating many extra turns.XXXXThis bot is extremely hard to beat because it gets stronger as the opponent's deck gets stronger.

player.name: Cache
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Cache strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Cartographer
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Cartographer strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Saboteur
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Although hated by a lot of players, the attack of this card is rather weak.

player.name: Sea Hag
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The strongest attack at $4 and an opener you can't easily ignore. XXXXThis bot buys two despite their uselesness once the Curses have run out.

player.name: Spy/Thief
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Play Thief, look at opponent's top card, find a Gold, put it back and steal it with your Thief. XXXXIt's fun, but fast strategies will get the majority of the Green cards before this takes over.XXXXSee also: http://dominionstrategy.com/2010/11/13/combo-of-the-day-7%C2%A0spythief/

player.name: Tactician/Vault
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy strives to play Tactician every turn. Vault allows it to discard the cards for $ before Tactician does.

player.name: Talisman/Quarry
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This bot buys up all Markets and Cities in frighteningly few turns, then explodes when the Cities reach level 2.XXXXSee also: http://dominionstrategy.com/2010/11/12/combo-of-the-day-1-quarrytalisman/

player.name: The Golden Deck
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Open Bishop/Chapel. Trash your entire deck until you're left with a Bishop, two Silvers, a Gold and a Province.XXXXFrom that point on trash a Province every turn with Bishop and buy a new Province.XXXXIf the strategy is behind in points it will buy Golds before Provinces hoping the opponent will choke on his own Green cards.XXXX

player.name: Torturer/Village
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: This strategy only works because opponents will keep discarding instead of sometimes gaining a Curse.XXXXStrategies that have trashers will however gain a Curse when they have a trasher in hand.

player.name: Tournament
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Tournament is a very swingy card. If both players go for it, the player in first seat has a big advantage.XXXXThe Prizes are integrated in the buy rules for simplicity.

player.name: Treasure Map/Warehouse
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Treasure Maps are usually a big gamble. Warehouse transforms it into a sure fire bet.

player.name: Venture
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Once this bot has 4 Golds it will buy Venture over it.

player.name: Venture/Bank (Col)
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: An illustration how strong Venture is in combination with Bank. Add a single Smithy (or other card drawer) to super charge this!XXXXThis bot doesn't buy Golds!

player.name: Wharf/Bank
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Wharf is very good at creating big hand sizes and gives an extra buy, which is exactly what Bank wants.

player.name: Witch
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: Witch is probably the strongest attack card in the game.

player.name: Witch and Moat for 3 or 4
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A Witch and money strategy for 3 or 4 players with a single Moat as defense

player.name: Witch for 3 or 4
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: A Witch and money strategy for 3 or 4 players

player.name: Workshop/Gardens
player.author: Geronimoo
player.description: The ultimate combo for the basic game. XXXXSurprisingly the optimal number of Workshops to get before starting to gain Gardens is 9. XXXXWhen two players are going for the same strategy, you only want 2 Workshops before you start gardening.

player.name: Adventurer
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys only Adventurer and treasure.

player.name: Big Money Ultimate (Col)
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Colony strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Bazaar
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Bazaar strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Big Money Ultimate
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized strategy that buys only treasure.

player.name: Bridge
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Bridge strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Bureaucrat
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Bureaucrat strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Caravan
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Caravan strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Chancellor
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Chancellor strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Coppersmith
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Coppersmith strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Council Room
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Council Room strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Counting House
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Counting House strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Courtyard
player.author: HiveMindEmulator
player.description: The optimized Courtyard bot that buys no other actions

player.name: Cutpurse
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Cutpurse strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Duke
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Duchy/Duke strategy that buys no actions.

player.name: Envoy
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Envoy strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Explorer
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Explorer strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Festival
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Festival strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Fortune Teller
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Fortune Teller strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Ghost Ship
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Ghost Ship strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Goons
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Goons strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Grand Market
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Grand Market strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Great Hall
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Great Hall strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Harem
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Harem strategy that buys no actions.

player.name: Harvest
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Harvest strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Haven
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Haven strategy that buys no other actions.

player.name: Herbalist
player.author: WanderingWinder
player.description: The optimized Herbalist strategy that buys no other actions.
